title-group.article-title: ADOPTION OF FORMAL AGRICULTURAL CREDIT BY OPINION LEADERS AND OTHER FARMERS IN DIFFERENTIALLY DEVELOPED VILLAGES OF BANGLADESH

abstract.p: Adoption behaviour of formal agricultural credit by the opinion leaders and farmers in a progressive and less progressive villages were studied. Overall adoption followed a pattern for different groups and sub-groups of the respondents. The likelihood of adoption of formal agricultural credit were higher among tenant farmers than the owner operators. Second, information variables have positive impact on the probability of adoption of formal agricultural credit. Moreover, along with the economic factors, non-economic factors also played significant role in the adoption of formal agricultural credit. Development agents should take the homogenous group-based credit disbursement indoctrination into account. For this process opinion leaders and their existing social networks should be used for the dissemination of loan information and possible loan guarantor schemes. Cost-saving measures to reach the remote and less progressive village were discussed.
